beer.beer_description:
Dry-Hopped Pale

Golden - Snappy - Citrus

Colour: 12 Units
Food Partner: King Prawn Dhansak
Spirit: Devotion

A zesty body and citrus aroma with a snappy finish. Drink to inspire you to an evening of passion!

Circa 500BC, during the Celtic Golden Age, most of mainland Europe was dominated by spiritual tribes of Celtic origin.

items.checkin_comment: Alright. Another average bitter. Tastes a tiny bit hoppy with some tang that hangs around. Medium carbonation. A lot of malt around. Bottle from lcbo.

user.bio: Mostly on Ratebeer as solidfunk. Also freelance beer stories for Smithsonian Mag, Virginia Craft Beer.

items.badge_description: Sometimes you need a break from all the hops, fruits, and spices. What better way than with a crisp, smooth Blonde Ale or Golden Ale? Basic but delicious. That's 80 different beers with the style of Blonde Ale or Golden Ale. Try 5 more for Level 17!
Had enough tea and biscuits? Head to the pub for a pint! That's at least 200 beers from the UK. Try 5 more for Level 41.

items.badge_description: Travel much? You must be a "brewsetter". That's at least a beer from 15 different countries. Try 5 more for Level 4!

items.checkin_comment:
LCi of course. 15 July 2009. With lunch 
Noted as Golden Ale from Celt Brewery at Caerphilly. No mention of the Age suffix. Also noted it darker than expected and did not mention hoppy - which I would if it had been   anyway it was good enough for 2 pints

user.bio: Shiny headed old git born In Sheffield South Yorkshire. Like dark beers, cats, Mrs W, trains, and old blues, RnR, RnB

user.bio:
Pittsburgh Steelers, N.Y. Rangers & N.Y. Mets super fan. 
Instagram: jeffm.4
The Mitten & The Bunny Beer Aficionado

“Mine Is The Story Of A Man Who Conquered Life With Beer In Hand” - 
Heavy Metal Accountant, Devoted Husband, Beer Lover
Drink great beer, explore all styles, eat delicious nutritious food,grow some! Travel, Visit Breweries, ⚽️ & MTB.

items.badge_description: Want to enjoy a day of brews, but need to keep your wits sharp? There are plenty of delicious brews under 5% for you to sip on throughout the day. That's 40 different beers with an ABV of 5% and lower. Try 5 more for Level 9!

items.badge_description: Traveling the world is hard, but not for you. It's as easy as cracking open a new brew! You have had a beer from at least 165 different regions around the world. Try 5 more for Level 34!

items.badge_description: Round round get around, you get around. Get around round round you get around. Ooh-ooh! That’s 5 different beers from 5 different countries in a row.

There's beer in them thar hills! You're setting off on your journey through the world of beer, but be sure to take a little time to get to know each brewery as you go. That's a beer from 10 different breweries. Try 5 more for Level 3!

Fresh from the tap is one of the best ways to enjoy a beer. Just try to use a glass and not drink directly from the tap, as tempting as it may be. That's 10 checkins with the serving style of Draft. Try 5 more for Level 3!

Round and round the wheel goes! Which style you’ll be drinking, nobody knows! Your desire to explore different styles is inspiring. Keep it up! That's a check-in to at least 10 different styles. Try 5 more for Level 3!

As the hub of the town's social scene, your local pub has what you're craving. Be sure to stop by for a pint or two! That's a beer at 5 different venues with the categories of Pub, Irish Pub or Gastropub. Visit 5 more for Level 2!

items.badge_description: Traveling the world is hard, but not for you. It's as easy as cracking open a new brew! You have had a beer from at least 370 different regions around the world. Try 5 more for Level 75!
